intro: Conostylis longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. Conostylis longifolia is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern and western Australia.
